00022 #include "mas5-stat/src/IntensityFileType.h"
00023 //
00024 #include "calvin_files/utils/src/StringUtils.h"
00025 //
00026 #include <cstring>
00027 #include <string>
00028 //
00029 
00030 using namespace std;
00031 using namespace affymetrix_fusion_io;
00032 using namespace affymetrix_calvin_io;
00033 using namespace affymetrix_calvin_utilities;
00034 
00035 /*
00036  * Check the DAT header for the HP style.
00037  */
00038 static bool IsDatHeaderStringFromHP(const string &datHeader)
00039 {
00040     int index = (int) datHeader.find(":CLS=");
00041     string strTypeAndID = datHeader.substr(index+1);
00042     strTypeAndID = strTypeAndID.substr(67);
00043 
00044     // There are several sub-fields in this field. The 
00045     // first sub field is the scanner ID, followed by the scanner type, 
00046     // followed by three spaces. If the scanner ID is absent, 
00047     // the field consists of four spaces
00048     // Find the 3 spaces that are after the scanner type
00049     int iStartScanType = (int) strTypeAndID.find(0x14);
00050 
00051     // If the start of the 3 spaces is at the begining, there is 
00052     // no scannertype and scanner ID
00053     string strScannerType;
00054     if (iStartScanType > 0)
00055     {
00056         strScannerType = strTypeAndID.substr(0, iStartScanType - 3);
00057         iStartScanType = (int) strScannerType.rfind(" ");
00058         if(iStartScanType <= 0)
00059             return true;
00060         
00061         strScannerType = strScannerType.substr(iStartScanType + 1, strScannerType.length() - iStartScanType - 1);
00062         return (strScannerType == "HP");
00063     }
00064     return true;
00065 }
00066 
00067 /*
00068  * Return a flag indicating if the CEL file is from an HP scanner.
00069  */
00070 bool FromHP(FusionCELData &cel)
00071 { 
00072     // Check if from the HT scanner. This had a upper left grid of 1,1
00073     affymetrix_fusion_io::FGridCoords grid = cel.GetGridCorners();
00074     if (grid.upperleft.x < 1.001f && grid.upperleft.y < 1.001f)
00075         return false;
00076 
00077     GenericData *gdata = cel.GetGenericData();
00078     if (gdata != NULL)
00079     {
00080         // Check for the scanne type parameter.
00081         int nparents = gdata->Header().GetGenericDataHdr()->GetParentCnt();
00082         for (int iparent=0; iparent<nparents; ++iparent)
00083         {
00084             GenericDataHeader pheader = gdata->Header().GetGenericDataHdr()->GetParent(iparent);
00085             ParameterNameValueType nvt;
00086             if (pheader.FindNameValParam(SCANNER_TYPE_PARAM_NAME, nvt) == true)
00087             {
00088                 wstring val = nvt.ToString();
00089                 if (val.size() == 0 || val == L"HP")
00090                     return true;
00091             }
00092             else if (pheader.FindNameValParam(DAT_HEADER_PARAM_NAME, nvt) == true)
00093             {
00094                 wstring val = nvt.ToString();
00095                 return IsDatHeaderStringFromHP(StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(val));
00096             }
00097         }
00098         return false;
00099     }
00100     else
00101     {
00102         // Check the DAT header. It it contains HP or blank for the scanner type
00103         // then it came from the HP scanner.
00104         string datHeader = StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(cel.GetDatHeader());
00105         return IsDatHeaderStringFromHP(datHeader);
00106     }
00107 }
